verse.name: v1
verse.lines: In early May, when skies are gay And green the plains and mountains, At break of day I rose to play Beside a little fountain.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: In garden close where shone the rose I heard a fiddle played, then A handsome knight that charmed my sight, Was dancing with a maiden.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Both fair of face, they turned with grace To tread their May-time measure. The flowering place, their close embrace: Their kisses brought them pleasure.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: But shortly they had slipped away To stroll among the bowers. To ease their heart, each played his part In love's games on the flowers.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: I crept ahead, all chill with dread, Lest someone there should see me. Bemused and sad because I had No joy in love to please me.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Then one of those I'd seen their rose And from afar off speaking, He questioned me, who I might be, And what I came there seeking.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: I stepped their way to sadly say How long I'd loved a lady, Who all my days my heart obeys, Full faithfully and steady.

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: Though still I bore a grief so sore In losing one so lovely, That surely I would come to die Unless she deigned to love me.

verse.name: v9
verse.lines: With wisdom rare, with tactful air They counselled and relieved me. They said their prayer was God might spare Some joy in love that grieved me.

verse.name: v10
verse.lines: Where all my gain was loss and pain So I in turn extended My thanks sincere, with many a tear, And them to God commended.
